content.description: Sit start on the lowest edge below the hueco like feature, feet below you or slightly out right. Pull on and execute the crux by bumping up to the better edges just above the start holds. From here adjust feet and then move straight up to the left lip of the boulder using holds on the arete or cool undercling and pinch features in the upper portion of the hueco like feature. Once at the lip pull an easy top out by rocking over the left side of this small boulder.
content.location: At the Fish and Chips wall, this problem is on the smaller boulder that is leaned up against the wall.

content.description: Named in honor of Bunnyhop Variation. Same start as Salmon Hop, on obvious jug rail at about waist height, find good feet and then move up to the lip through a series of good crimps on the face, finishing the same as for Salmon Hop.
content.location: In the middle of the Fish and Chips wall, just left of Blackbird and just right of the boulder leaning on the wall (where clam chowder and stuffies start).

content.description: Eliminate dyno named in honor of Bunny Hop. Start on obvious jug rail at about waist height, find your feet, pull on and make a big move up and right to the lip; match the lip, bring up your feet, and top out.
content.location: In the middle of the Fish and Chips wall, just left of Blackbird and just right of the boulder leaning on the wall (where clam chowder and stuffies start).

content.description: Start at the bottom of the right arete, pull on with good feet below you and tend left up the arete. Good hand holds, and feet trailing behind you, make for an easy romp up the arete to positive jugs at the top out.
content.location: At the Fish and Chips wall, this problem is on the smaller boulder that is leaned up against the wall; starting on the right side of the small boulder, unlike Clam Chowder and Stuffies.

content.description: The far left arete with an unappealing landing. Start standing atop the pedestal on the big, perfect mail slot. Climb the prominent arete that trends to the left. One could likely exit early onto the right slab from the starting position; I didn't try doing so, but it would probably be easier than climbing the arete. Otherwise, this climb is fantastic!
content.location: Between the "Sink or Swim" and "Fish and Chips" walls. The obvious arete that can be seen when approaching from the most commonly used trail.

content.description: Start down low on the same edge as for Stuffies, low feet below you or to the right, pull on and make the same first move up to the better edges at the bottom of the hueco feature. From here, adjust feet and trend right from the hueco out to the right arete of the boulder. Once you get your hands on the arete, you have awesome feet and can then move up the right arete to top out there with good holds.
content.location: At the Fish and Chips wall, this problem is on the smaller boulder that is leaned up against the wall.

content.description: good problem start on rail sitting move left to small sharp crimp and follow through small pocket and wide pinch to a large outward left move to a small crimp move right hand to sloper and bump again to block move into fin and top out left .
content.location: if facing the wall all the way on the right side of the boulder wall you will see a good rail about waist high and a small crimp above and left that is the first move follow the line horizontal and left to fin in crack

content.description: start left hand on mitten hold and right on pinch under bulge big bump right up to sloper. match and  move straight up to two small sloper crimps bump to two more and top out straight up on horn
content.location: if looking at wall just before big crack left you will see a bulge and below a large hold that looks like a mitten and right a pinch those are the start holds .

content.description: good rock, part of the same formation that makes up pond cave but around to the right. partial sun. and pretty long wall
